decks.notes: This deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle to ramp up mana quickly, allowing for powerful plays like casting Natural Order to bring out Craterhoof Behemoth for a game-winning attack. The deck also utilizes powerful green creatures and spells to control the board, with cards like Collector Ouphe to disrupt opponents' strategies and Endurance for graveyard hate. The deck aims to establish board presence early and overwhelm opponents with big threats, while also having access to tools like Green Sun's Zenith for tutor flexibility and utility creatures like Quirion Ranger for additional value.

In this Dimir Tempo deck, the focus is on playing threats and disrupting your opponent's game plan while maintaining card advantage. The deck utilizes efficient removal spells like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize to control the board, along with countermagic like Daze and Force of Will to protect your creatures. Murktide Regent and Nethergoyf serve as powerful threats that can quickly close out the game. Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student provides card draw and selection, while Orcish Bowmasters and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares can disrupt your opponent's strategy. The deck aims to pressure the opponent while disrupting their plays to secure a victory.

This deck focuses on quickly and efficiently combo-ing off by utilizing a high number of low-cost spells to cheat out creatures like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer, which in turn enable the player to consistently mill their entire deck and win the game with Thassa's Oracle. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Duress to protect the combo and ensure a smooth win. Agadeem's Awakening serves as a strong utility land for reanimation, while cards like Pact of Negation provide protection against opposing disruption.

This deck focuses on using control elements like counterspells, removal, and disruption to control the game and slow down the opponent's game plan. It utilizes Stoneforge Mystic to tutor up powerful equipment like Batterskull and swords to gain incremental advantages. The inclusion of powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd, as well as value engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student, provides additional threats and card advantage. The deck also includes support cards like Daze, Stifle, and Wasteland to disrupt the opponent's strategy and gain tempo advantage.

This Death & Taxes deck aims to disrupt opponents' strategies by utilizing a combination of aggressive creatures and disruptive spells. With a focus on resource denial through cards like Wasteland and Thalia, Guardian of Thraben, the deck looks to establish early board presence and control the game through various means such as flickering creatures with cards like Flickerwisp and Yorion, Sky Nomad. By leveraging the synergies between its creatures and spells, the deck seeks to apply pressure on opponents while hindering their ability to execute their game plan effectively.

The main focus of this deck is to maintain tempo and disruption through a combination of hand disruption tools like Thoughtseize and counterspells like Force of Will, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Barrowgoyf. Utilizing cards like Brainstorm and Ponder, the deck aims to constantly adapt to the opponent's actions and stay ahead in board presence. Wasteland is also included to disrupt opponent's mana base. This Dimir Tempo deck aims to control the game and finish off opponents quickly before they can stabilize.

The deck focuses on utilizing a combination of counterspells, removal spells, card draw, and hand disruption to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. It also includes powerful creatures like Kaito, Bane of Nightmares and Murktide Regent to apply pressure and close out the game. The deck aims to outvalue the opponent by generating card advantage and efficiently dealing with threats, while also having the flexibility to adapt to different matchups through its diverse selection of spells and creatures.

This deck aims to quickly fill the graveyard with key combo pieces and then win the game in one explosive turn by casting a series of spells that abuse the graveyard mechanics. It utilizes cards like Balustrade Spy and Undercity Informer to mill the entire library, then uses cards like Dread Return to bring back key cards like Thassa's Oracle for a win condition. The deck also includes protection in the form of Pact of Negation and disruption through Cabal Therapy and Thoughtseize to ensure the combo goes off successfully.

The deck focuses on quickly establishing a board presence and applying pressure on the opponent using cheap spells like Lightning Bolt and Daze to control the game. It also utilizes card advantage engines like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Dragon's Rage Channeler to maintain momentum. The deck's key strength lies in its ability to disrupt the opponent with cards like Force of Will and Wasteland while also having threats like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower to close out the game quickly. The mana base is optimized for consistency and efficiency in casting spells.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game early on with disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Wasteland while also applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. The deck aims to maintain tempo by using efficient removal like Fatal Push and Daze, backed up by powerful card selection tools such as Brainstorm and Ponder. The synergy between control elements and aggressive threats allows the deck to dictate the pace of the game and disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly play and utilize artifacts in combination with aggro strategies, focusing on utilizing cards like Emry, Lurker of the Loch and Mishra's Bauble to create a fast and efficient board presence. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with a combination of artifact creatures like Kappa Cannoneer and Patchwork Automaton, while utilizing cards like Urza's Bauble and Urza's Saga to generate card advantage and enhance the deck's synergy. Additionally, the deck includes protection with Force of Will and disruption with cards like Sink into Stupor to control the game tempo.

The deck focuses on utilizing Gaea's Cradle and mana ramp creatures to quickly generate mana and overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures like Wight of the Reliquary, Craterhoof Behemoth, and Atraxa, Grand Unifier. The deck also includes disruption elements like Thoughtseize and Wasteland to control the game state and disrupt the opponent's strategy. Green Sun's Zenith and Natural Order are used to tutor up key creatures, while cards like Endurance and Collector Ouphe provide additional utility and disruption. The deck aims to control the game through mana advantage and powerful threats.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful Eldrazi creatures and disrupt their game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thought-Knot Seer. The deck also aims to accelerate its mana production with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, allowing for quick deployment of its threats. Additionally, the inclusion of cards like Wasteland and Wastescape Battlemage helps to control the opponent's resources and maintain board dominance. The deck's strategy is to apply early pressure and close out the game before the opponent can establish a strong defense.

The main focus of this UR Aggro deck is to quickly establish control with powerful early creatures like Delver of Secrets and Cori-Steel Cutter, supported by efficient removal spells such as Lightning Bolt and Chain Lightning. With a low mana curve and disruptive cards like Daze and Force of Will, the deck aims to apply consistent pressure on the opponent while disrupting their game plan. The inclusion of Murktide Regent adds a late-game threat that can quickly close out games. Wasteland and Thundering Falls are included to disrupt the opponent's mana base and keep them on the back foot.

The main concept of this Dimir Tempo deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan through a combination of hand disruption spells like Thoughtseize and countermagic like Force of Will, while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Murktide Regent and Brazen Borrower. Additionally, the deck aims to control the opponent's resources by utilizing cards like Wasteland and Daze to slow down the opponent's development. By combining disruption, efficient threats, and control elements, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while clocking them out with its aggressive creatures.

The main concept of this UR Aggro deck is to utilize low-cost aggressive creatures and efficient burn spells to quickly win the game by applying early pressure on the opponent. The deck focuses on cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Delver of Secrets, and Lightning Bolt to deal damage quickly while also disrupting the opponent's game plan with counter spells like Force of Will and Daze. By combining efficient threats with powerful disruption, the deck aims to win the game before the opponent can stabilize or mount a defense.
